intro: Glechon myrtoides, commonly known as the rock fig, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible, fig-like fruits that are often consumed by birds and small mammals. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens.
